meanings.definition: Make (someone) adopt radically different beliefs by using systematic and often forcible pressure.
meanings.sent1: The cult leader tried to brainwash his followers into believing his every word.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been brainwashed by the misleading advertisements.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character joked about being brainwashed into thinking carrots were evil.
meanings.sent4: The movie portrayed the villain as a master manipulator who brainwashed innocent people.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used fun games to explain how advertisers try to brainwash us into buying things we don't need.

meanings.definition: A person who has been brainwashed.
meanings.sent1: The brainwashed individual could not remember their true identity.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a brainwashed puppet, controlled by outside influences.
meanings.sent3: The brainwashed character in the story suddenly realized the truth and broke free.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as a brainwashed victim of society's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the brainwashed as lost souls in need of redemption.
